The photo has been digitally altered: The expert's verdict states that the image has been manipulated, with the words on the sign being changed from "Lancaster County" to "Women of the Democrat Party." This alteration was identified through a reverse-image search.
Authenticity of the original image: The expert mentions that the original version of the photograph can be found in Getty Images stock photos. Although the exact date of the photo is not provided, it is mentioned that it is most likely from one of the KKK marches on Washington in the mid-1920s.
Verification through historical sources: The expert refers to a historical news website called Timeline, which published an article about the formation of a KKK branch for women. The same photo of the group of women appears in the story, further supporting its authenticity.
Facebook: s efforts to combat false news: The expert mentions that the viral photo was flagged by Facebook as part of their efforts to combat false news and misinformation on their platform. This indicates that Facebook's fact-checking mechanisms were employed to verify the authenticity of the claim.
